page.title: 05SEDGEFIELD AN OVERVIEW
page.content: {Sedgefield}was founded in Norman times.A market charter was granted in 1312 A.D. Sedgefield gives it's name to the local{District Council}whose headquarters are situated at Spennymoor. In the 19th century it was an important coach centre with a daily service or "Expedition" to Leeds. The tower of the{medieval church}can be seen for miles around.The church stands at the centre of the village green at the highest point. The former rectory of the church has now become the local Community Association Centre and is known as { Ceddesfeld Hall. { Sedgefield racecourse}is used for steeple-chasing.It is the only racecourse in county Durham.
